Wheat Rust.description: Rust diseases are caused by fungi that attack wheat leaves, stems, and grains
Wheat Rust.treatment: Apply fungicides containing tebuconazole or propiconazole, use resistant varieties, practice crop rotation
Wheat Rust.prevention: Plant resistant varieties, avoid excessive nitrogen, maintain proper spacing, remove crop debris

Wheat Blast.description: Wheat blast is a devastating fungal disease caused by Magnaporthe oryzae
Wheat Blast.treatment: Apply fungicides containing azoxystrobin or pyraclostrobin, remove infected plants immediately
Wheat Blast.prevention: Use certified disease-free seeds, practice crop rotation, maintain field hygiene

Wheat Scab.description: Fusarium head blight (scab) affects wheat heads and reduces grain quality
Wheat Scab.treatment: Apply fungicides during flowering, harvest early if possible, clean contaminated grain
Wheat Scab.prevention: Plant resistant varieties, avoid planting after corn, maintain proper drainage

Wheat Healthy.description: Wheat plants appear healthy with no visible disease symptoms
Wheat Healthy.treatment: Continue current care practices, monitor regularly for any changes
Wheat Healthy.prevention: Maintain proper nutrition, irrigation, and pest management

Rice Blast.description: Rice blast is caused by Magnaporthe oryzae and affects leaves, stems, and panicles
Rice Blast.treatment: Apply fungicides containing tricyclazole or azoxystrobin, use resistant varieties
Rice Blast.prevention: Plant resistant varieties, avoid excessive nitrogen, maintain proper water management

Rice Brown Spot.description: Brown spot is caused by Bipolaris oryzae and affects rice leaves and grains
Rice Brown Spot.treatment: Apply fungicides containing propiconazole, improve soil fertility
Rice Brown Spot.prevention: Use balanced fertilization, maintain proper water levels, plant resistant varieties

Rice Bacterial Blight.description: Bacterial blight is caused by Xanthomonas oryzae and affects rice leaves
Rice Bacterial Blight.treatment: Apply copper-based bactericides, use resistant varieties
Rice Bacterial Blight.prevention: Use disease-free seeds, avoid overhead irrigation, maintain field hygiene

Rice Healthy.description: Rice plants appear healthy with no visible disease symptoms
Rice Healthy.treatment: Continue current care practices, monitor regularly for any changes
Rice Healthy.prevention: Maintain proper nutrition, water management, and pest control

Corn Northern Leaf Blight.description: Northern leaf blight is caused by the fungus Exserohilum turcicum
Corn Northern Leaf Blight.treatment: Apply fungicides containing azoxystrobin or propiconazole
Corn Northern Leaf Blight.prevention: Use resistant varieties, practice crop rotation, maintain proper spacing

Corn Common Rust.description: Common rust is caused by the fungus Puccinia sorghi
Corn Common Rust.treatment: Apply fungicides containing azoxystrobin or propiconazole
Corn Common Rust.prevention: Use resistant varieties, practice crop rotation, avoid overhead watering

Corn Gray Leaf Spot.description: Gray leaf spot is caused by the fungus Cercospora zeae-maydis
Corn Gray Leaf Spot.treatment: Apply fungicides containing azoxystrobin or propiconazole
Corn Gray Leaf Spot.prevention: Use resistant varieties, practice crop rotation, maintain proper spacing

Corn Southern Rust.description: Southern rust is caused by Puccinia polysora and affects corn leaves
Corn Southern Rust.treatment: Apply fungicides containing azoxystrobin or pyraclostrobin
Corn Southern Rust.prevention: Use resistant varieties, monitor weather conditions, apply preventive fungicides

Corn Healthy.description: Corn plants appear healthy with no visible disease symptoms
Corn Healthy.treatment: Continue current care practices, monitor regularly for any changes
Corn Healthy.prevention: Maintain proper nutrition, irrigation, and pest management

Barley Scald.description: Scald is caused by Rhynchosporium secalis and affects barley leaves
Barley Scald.treatment: Apply fungicides containing azoxystrobin or propiconazole
Barley Scald.prevention: Use resistant varieties, practice crop rotation, maintain proper spacing

Barley Net Blotch.description: Net blotch is caused by Pyrenophora teres and affects barley leaves
Barley Net Blotch.treatment: Apply fungicides containing azoxystrobin or propiconazole
Barley Net Blotch.prevention: Use resistant varieties, practice crop rotation, avoid excessive nitrogen

Barley Healthy.description: Barley plants appear healthy with no visible disease symptoms
Barley Healthy.treatment: Continue current care practices, monitor regularly for any changes
Barley Healthy.prevention: Maintain proper nutrition, irrigation, and pest management

Tomato Bacterial Spot.description: Bacterial spot is a common disease of tomato caused by Xanthomonas vesicatoria
Tomato Bacterial Spot.treatment: Apply copper-based fungicides, improve air circulation, avoid overhead watering, remove infected plant debris
Tomato Bacterial Spot.prevention: Use disease-free seeds, practice crop rotation, maintain proper spacing between plants

Tomato Early Blight.description: Early blight is caused by the fungus Alternaria solani
Tomato Early Blight.treatment: Apply fungicides containing chlorothalonil or copper, remove infected leaves, improve air circulation
Tomato Early Blight.prevention: Mulch around plants, avoid overhead watering, practice crop rotation

Tomato Late Blight.description: Late blight is caused by the oomycete Phytophthora infestans
Tomato Late Blight.treatment: Apply fungicides containing chlorothalonil or copper, remove infected plants immediately
Tomato Late Blight.prevention: Avoid overhead watering, ensure good drainage, practice crop rotation

Tomato Leaf Mold.description: Leaf mold is caused by the fungus Passalora fulva
Tomato Leaf Mold.treatment: Apply fungicides, improve air circulation, reduce humidity
Tomato Leaf Mold.prevention: Use resistant varieties, maintain proper spacing, avoid overhead watering

Tomato Septoria Leaf Spot.description: Septoria leaf spot is caused by the fungus Septoria lycopersici
Tomato Septoria Leaf Spot.treatment: Apply fungicides containing chlorothalonil, remove infected leaves
Tomato Septoria Leaf Spot.prevention: Practice crop rotation, avoid overhead watering, maintain clean garden

Tomato Spider Mites.description: Spider mites are tiny arachnids that feed on plant sap
Tomato Spider Mites.treatment: Apply insecticidal soap or neem oil, increase humidity, remove heavily infested leaves
Tomato Spider Mites.prevention: Regular monitoring, maintain proper humidity, avoid over-fertilization

Tomato Target Spot.description: Target spot is caused by the fungus Corynespora cassiicola
Tomato Target Spot.treatment: Apply fungicides, improve air circulation, remove infected leaves
Tomato Target Spot.prevention: Practice crop rotation, maintain proper spacing, avoid overhead watering

Tomato Yellow Leaf Curl Virus.description: Yellow leaf curl virus is transmitted by whiteflies
Tomato Yellow Leaf Curl Virus.treatment: Control whitefly populations, remove infected plants, apply systemic insecticides
Tomato Yellow Leaf Curl Virus.prevention: Use resistant varieties, control weeds, monitor for whiteflies

Tomato Mosaic Virus.description: Mosaic virus is transmitted by aphids and mechanical means
Tomato Mosaic Virus.treatment: Remove infected plants, control aphid populations, disinfect tools
Tomato Mosaic Virus.prevention: Use disease-free seeds, control aphids, practice good hygiene

Tomato Healthy.description: The tomato plant appears healthy with no visible disease symptoms
Tomato Healthy.treatment: Continue current care practices, monitor regularly for any changes
Tomato Healthy.prevention: Maintain proper watering, fertilization, and pest management

Potato Early Blight.description: Early blight in potatoes is caused by Alternaria solani
Potato Early Blight.treatment: Apply fungicides containing chlorothalonil, remove infected foliage
Potato Early Blight.prevention: Practice crop rotation, maintain proper spacing, avoid overhead watering

Potato Late Blight.description: Late blight in potatoes is caused by Phytophthora infestans
Potato Late Blight.treatment: Apply fungicides containing chlorothalonil or copper, remove infected plants
Potato Late Blight.prevention: Avoid overhead watering, ensure good drainage, practice crop rotation

Potato Scab.description: Potato scab is caused by Streptomyces scabies and affects tuber surfaces
Potato Scab.treatment: Maintain soil pH around 5.2-5.5, use resistant varieties, rotate crops
Potato Scab.prevention: Avoid liming, maintain proper soil moisture, use certified seed potatoes

Potato Blackleg.description: Blackleg is caused by Pectobacterium atrosepticum and affects stems and tubers
Potato Blackleg.treatment: Remove infected plants, improve drainage, use certified seed
Potato Blackleg.prevention: Use disease-free seed potatoes, avoid waterlogging, practice crop rotation

Potato Healthy.description: The potato plant appears healthy with no visible disease symptoms
Potato Healthy.treatment: Continue current care practices, monitor regularly for any changes
Potato Healthy.prevention: Maintain proper watering, fertilization, and pest management

Pepper Bacterial Spot.description: Bacterial spot in peppers is caused by Xanthomonas vesicatoria
Pepper Bacterial Spot.treatment: Apply copper-based bactericides, improve air circulation, avoid overhead watering
Pepper Bacterial Spot.prevention: Use disease-free seeds, practice crop rotation, maintain proper spacing

Pepper Anthracnose.description: Anthracnose in peppers is caused by Colletotrichum species
Pepper Anthracnose.treatment: Apply fungicides containing chlorothalonil, remove infected fruits

Cucumber Powdery Mildew.treatment: Apply fungicides containing sulfur or potassium bicarbonate
Cucumber Powdery Mildew.prevention: Use resistant varieties, improve air circulation, avoid overhead watering

Cucumber Anthracnose.description: Anthracnose in cucumbers is caused by Colletotrichum orbiculare
Cucumber Anthracnose.treatment: Apply fungicides containing chlorothalonil, remove infected plant parts

Lettuce Downy Mildew.prevention: Use resistant varieties, avoid overhead watering, maintain proper spacing

Lettuce Bacterial Soft Rot.description: Bacterial soft rot is caused by Pectobacterium carotovorum
Lettuce Bacterial Soft Rot.treatment: Remove infected plants, improve drainage, avoid overhead watering

Carrot Leaf Blight.description: Leaf blight in carrots is caused by Alternaria dauci
Carrot Leaf Blight.treatment: Apply fungicides containing chlorothalonil, remove infected foliage
Carrot Leaf Blight.prevention: Practice crop rotation, avoid overhead watering, maintain proper spacing

Carrot Root Rot.description: Root rot in carrots is caused by various soilborne pathogens
Carrot Root Rot.treatment: Improve soil drainage, apply fungicides, use resistant varieties

Apple Scab.description: Apple scab is caused by Venturia inaequalis and affects leaves and fruits
Apple Scab.treatment: Apply fungicides containing captan or sulfur, prune for air circulation
Apple Scab.prevention: Use resistant varieties, remove fallen leaves, maintain proper spacing

Apple Fire Blight.description: Fire blight is caused by Erwinia amylovora and affects blossoms and shoots
Apple Fire Blight.treatment: Prune infected branches, apply copper sprays, use resistant varieties
Apple Fire Blight.prevention: Avoid excessive nitrogen, prune during dry weather, use resistant varieties

Apple Powdery Mildew.description: Powdery mildew in apples is caused by Podosphaera leucotricha

Citrus Canker.description: Citrus canker is caused by Xanthomonas citri and affects leaves, stems, and fruits
Citrus Canker.treatment: Apply copper-based bactericides, remove infected plant parts
Citrus Canker.prevention: Use disease-free planting material, maintain field hygiene, control leaf miners

Citrus Greening.description: Citrus greening (HLB) is caused by Candidatus Liberibacter and transmitted by psyllids
Citrus Greening.treatment: Control psyllid vectors, remove infected trees, use systemic insecticides
